Reviews.Title: Not too bad
Reviews.Author: Cyclical
Reviews.Content: Purchased this at my local walmart for $328.It comes with a wifi usb stick so you can connect to your in home WiFi. You can also connect it via ethernet if you prefer. Netflix is a tad slow starting and navigating, but once it gets going it works very well. I don't have Vudu so I can't review on that. The mediaconnect function works pretty well.Picture looks great, the TV also puts out little to no heat.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic value and easy setup with internet connection
Reviews.Author: Rodney Timbrook
Reviews.Content: I love just about everything on this TV except the fact that it does not directly connect or have the capacity to connect (without buying additional hardware) to my Amazon Prime account.....it connected easily to Netflix, Vudu, Hulu, and other services.  Can Phillips and Amazon get together to allow accessing Amazon on this great TV?As for the TV, it has great picture clarity, great sound, and a great remote control.  I'm so glad to have purchased this TV--my first new set in 24 years. It was like going from a Yugo to a Porsche.....

Reviews.Title: Slow User Interface and Remote will Break Your Thumb
Reviews.Author: R. Gupta "rg"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV thinking I am buying quality, but there are two major issues with this TV which a $79 Roku does better:1. The user interface when navigating through NetTV options or Netfilx movies or HuluPlus, is very slow. The interface does not respond the way it should2. The remote control wheel key is very hard to use & needs multiple presses.If you do not mind pressing the remote button multiple times to get the TV to respond, you will enjoy this TV since it does have some cool features.Anyone experiencing the same issue or it is just that I got a bad remote?

Reviews.Title: Terrible TV, Terrible Support
Reviews.Author: sassypants
Reviews.Content: After setting up the TV and updating the software, I immediately tried to access Netflix. After 2 hours of waiting for it to load, I contacted customer support. The support tech I was talking to offered several generic and unhelpful tips, one of which was that I put my TV within 20 feet of the wireless router (which is both ridiculous and impossible in my situation), before hanging up on me. When I called back, I was told that all available techs were busy and was put on hold for over half an hour before the phone line went dead.I will absolutely not be buying any more Philips products if this is how they treat their customers.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: ked1987
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV at Walmart and definitely wasn't disappointed.Pros:- Very thin- Images are crisp- Wifi straight out the box- Price isn't too bad at all for the features- MediaConnect eliminates the need for cordsCons:- Remote needs a keyboard (like the Vizio tvs)- App library is small- Apps move too slowly- MediaConnect has a slight delay but nothing to cry aboutOverall, it's a pretty great tv but the software prevents it from getting 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: its a very good tv
Reviews.Author: yolvandy vargas
Reviews.Content: this is a very good tv for the price and has wi-fi and many things, is ultra slim and i like, is led tv. is all good

Reviews.Title: The best in its category
Reviews.Author: Habilny
Reviews.Content: this TV is one of the best TVs in its category compared to its price. I have 2 TVs one 40" in my living room and a 32" in my bedroom. no problems connecting to the internet wirelessly, watching Netflix or you tube. the picture is unbelievable compared to Sony or Samsung. the only issue I will mention is the remote control that Philips needs to work on it. despite that i will give it 5 stars and i already recommended it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Nice smart TV
Reviews.Author: Regi
Reviews.Content: Wanted a good Smart TV for the exercise room and this fits the bill perfectly. NetTV works fine, I have only tried Youtube and it doesnt have any lags or anything. Mediaconnect works like a charm. I use Windows computers(Vista all the way thru 8).

Reviews.Title: Does NOT work with Mac; Ignorant Tech Support
Reviews.Author: A. D. LORD
Reviews.Content: I bought this set mainly for the unique feature of wireless connectivity between laptop and TV (no more HDMI cord!) The box and the instructions both said their MediaConnect software works with Mac (OS 10.5 or higher). Mine's 10.6, and it most assuredly does not work. I spent three hours on the phone with a very nice tech support person who finally told me that there must be something wrong with my Powerbook. Of course there isn't. I just love "support" like that! The software says it's finished downloading, but does not open. I wish I could sue Philips in small claims court to get compensated for the wasted time and aggravation. Punitive damages for false advertising would be nice, too! Judging from the other comments, I'm not the only person who believed the lie on the box that their MediaConnect is Mac compatible. Wasting thousands of hours of customers' time through false claims on packaging really should carry some monetary penalty.

Reviews.Title: Bought it a month ago
Reviews.Author: Ad
Reviews.Content: every thing was as posted on the ads.The only problem i had was the remote control. It is not only user friendly, but has to be push hardly to act the command.The quality of screen and specifically, the sound is great. So far i didnt have any problem except the remote control design.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Critical
Reviews.Content: I'm afraid to get a different brand of LED tv now because I'm so amazed with how great this one is.  Brilliant colors, sound is facing rear of TV so a sound bar is recommended if you're a sound critique.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Peter "Gadgets"
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV on sale at Costco to replace an old TV. Sharp picture and decent sound.  Very thin and light and consumes very little power. Setup was fairly straight forward.  I had a lot more trouble getting a Verizon Fios HD box to work (but that is another story).  Smart TV features are nice but I don't know if I will use them much.

Reviews.Title: I was suprised
Reviews.Author: Esther R. Carpenter "Mahagonye"
Reviews.Content: This TV is very nice its ultra thin and the picture is beautiful, also the net apps are pretty cool. Kind of difficult when you need a keyboard but other than that a great TV

Reviews.Title: It's a great TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Juan Quiroz "JJQV"
Reviews.Content: This TV is really good. When I first turned on, the TV asked a software update which did just with a click and downloaded it from my home WiFi connection. I recommend you have a good broadband internet connection to take advantage of all the features that the TV comes with NetTV application. But overall it is a great and entertaining TV.

Reviews.Title: Won't work outside USA or Canada
Reviews.Author: Marcela
Reviews.Content: Net services embedded, including Netflix won't work outside USA or Canada. This was a major disappointment for me because I bought this TV to use Netflix at home, in Brazil. Media Connect won't play .avi or mp4 files either. The image quality is good though, but if I could, I would return it.

Reviews.Title: Wifi connect does *not* work with Macs
Reviews.Author: Adit B
Reviews.Content: At this point I assume that no one at Phillips knows the difference between a PC and a MAC.This Phillips site ([...]) says it works with macs: "Connect a PC or MAC to a TV wirelessly with MediaConnect".This Phillips site ([...]) where you download the software does not give a mac option, the software is for PC only.The friendly Phillips rep on this site ([...]) says the quote from site #1 "are meant for European models only, not US models."So there you go. If you want to connect to a mac, import this tv from Europe.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: ancagale
Reviews.Content: The TV is really nice. Very good picture quality. Slim and light. Good buy for the price. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Not bad overall
Reviews.Author: Jeffy
Reviews.Content: For the price, it's not bad at all.Netflix operates rather slowly, and sometimes video isn't even coming in though while sound is (this is on the day we bought it)But overall, it's fine.  Fine clarity, and it replaced a similar tv in our room that was smaller, but didn't have these Netflix issues.

Reviews.Title: Worth and nice tv.
Reviews.Author: Che
Reviews.Content: Easy set up and done. Net tv was great hope there will be more apps in the near future. I will buy another one for my sons bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: C. Barnes
Reviews.Content: This has been a nice TV so far--had it for almost a month; no problems with set-up or the picture.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: luis adrian
Reviews.Content: Tremendous TV for so little moneyI love great TVA TV very thin, light and no heatTo all those who have known my podium view are delighted and want to buy one

Reviews.Title: Misleading - NOT MAC COMPATIBLE
Reviews.Author: kabuki
Reviews.Content: Do NOT be mislead by the claims that MediaConnect is Mac compatible! This is a nice television; however, it was more expensive than the other TVs we were considering. We justified the price based upon the MediaConnect feature, which allows you to connect the television to your wireless network. The outside of the box also says that you can connect your PC, and it says that it is Windows and MacOS X 10.5 and above compatible. However, when we get home and do a little more research online, we find that you need to run it through a Windows environment on your Mac.If we're going to use an Apple TV box anyway, we might as well buy a cheaper television set. So this one is going back.

ProductInfo.Features:
iPTV
Wi-Fi
Net Apps
Media Connect
DLNA
ProductInfo.Name: Philips 32PFL4907 32-Inch 60Hz LED-Lit TV (Black) (2012 Model)
